description: FLP files do not store the actual audio that appears in the project. Instead, the files contain references to the audio files. Therefore, if you move an FLP file or the files it references, such as a .WAV sample file, or SimSynth or DrumSynth preset file, the project may not play correctly in FL Studio.
NOTE: FL Studio was formerly known as FruityLoops, which was originally released in 1998. FruityLoops became FL Studio with the release of version 4 in March 2003.

common_filenames.description: flipanim_project_<YYYYMMDD>_<TTTT>.flp - The default filename given to FlipAnim projects downloaded as FLP files. The YYYYMMDD stands for the year, month, and day the file was downloaded and the TTTT stands for the time it was downloaded. For example, an FLP file downloaded on April 16, 2019 at 10:59 am is named flipanim_project_20190416_1059.flp .
